comment: Not a terrible class. 6 HW (Quizzes) 2 exams and a discussion post. I recommend that if you take this class, be familiar with the excel formula's of the chapter problems because for the HW and exams, ROUNDING MATTERS! no matter if you are off by .01, it will be counted wrong. He does not show solutions either. Also, the book is your best friend.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: While he is extremely tough on rounding errors, you only need to get 45% of the available 1000 points to earn a C in the class. Graded on 6 homework assignments, 2 exams, and one discussion board assignment. If you follow the right formulas from the textbook and use excel properly, you can do just fine in this class. It's difficult but fair.

comment: In the beginning, I thought the professor and the whole course was flawed and too difficult. The professor makes it clear you truly do have to work for your grade and in the end Professor Mazotta was very generous.

Professor Mazzotta does not deserve some of the hate he gets on here. Yes, his class is challenging, but what are you paying for school for if not to learn? Students who want to gain a real proficient understanding of material should take his class, but if you are lazy and want everything handed to you on a plate -- you should probably stay away.

Avoid if possible. The online lectures and the book (publisher recommends for a graduate course) used make the subject matter more confusing than what it actually is. No feedback is given and you cannot see your test results other than the grade. If you think you are on the correct path there is no way of finding out what you have done wrong.

His class is designed to make you think and find the answers on your own. His study material is just a guide and quizzes/exams are completely different than example problems. Not an easy A, but worth taking if you don't mind putting in strong effort and you actually want to learn the material. He will certainly help you if you come to him. Good guy

Take him if he is your only choice. Tough subject, relies on powerpoint videos made two years ago. Pretty much have to learn the material yourself from the textbook. Will curve grades if class average is low.
